content.raw:
I guess this is because you're inserting them in model coordinates, right?

Try also this: On the main window, insert a cube, pause the simulation and rotate the cube to some weird pose. Now edit the cube. When you insert parts on the editor, they appear in the same orientation as the cube.
content.html:
I guess this is because you're inserting them in model coordinates, right?

Try also this: On the main window, insert a cube, pause the simulation and rotate the cube to some weird pose. Now edit the cube. When you insert parts on the editor, they appear in the same orientation as the cube.

content.raw: Even though houses are static, when they're loaded static appears disabled and if you save and exit they are not static.
content.html: Even though houses are static, when they're loaded static appears disabled and if you save and exit they are not static.

content.raw: Edit table. When you insert simple shapes, they appear inside the ground.
content.html: Edit table. When you insert simple shapes, they appear inside the ground.

content.raw: Edit the monkey wrench, change colors to blue (0, 0, 1) and apply, color changes on preview. Save and Exit, it shows white. It's probably related to the material being specified in the collada file...?
content.html: Edit the monkey wrench, change colors to blue (0, 0, 1) and apply, color changes on preview. Save and Exit, it shows white. It's probably related to the material being specified in the collada file...?

update.description:
Add ability to edit existing model:

1. insert model

1. right click on model and select `Edit Model`

1. voila
update.title: Model editor - edit existing model

content.raw: for reference, most mobile-base robot models we work with has the origin at the bottom-center of the model.
content.html: for reference, most mobile-base robot models we work with has the origin at the bottom-center of the model.

content.raw: We could also modify the insert behavior to snap the object to the ground plane (not for this pull-request though).
content.html: We could also modify the insert behavior to snap the object to the ground plane (not for this pull-request though).

content.raw: I'm wondering if it's a good idea to set the origin of the model to be in the centroid. After I save my models and try to insert them from the insert tab, they appear inside the ground...
content.html: I'm wondering if it's a good idea to set the origin of the model to be in the centroid. After I save my models and try to insert them from the insert tab, they appear inside the ground...

content.raw: Just tested on default and confirmed that it isn't working there either.
content.html: Just tested on default and confirmed that it isn't working there either.

content.raw:
regression after changing the behavior in Visual. Now any values in material script name will override rgba values - otherwise its causing too many issues in material updates. This is somewhat consistent with Ogre except Ogre tries to blend the texture with ambient/diffuse/specular rgb values. 

fixed in e2ae1d8
content.html:
regression after changing the behavior in Visual. Now any values in material script name will override rgba values - otherwise its causing too many issues in material updates. This is somewhat consistent with Ogre except Ogre tries to blend the texture with ambient/diffuse/specular rgb values.

fixed in e2ae1d8

content.raw:
ya that's the expected behavior now. If there is a material script then the rgba values are not used. 

So clear the material script name and change the ambient again, it should work. Note that you can not revert back to the old material as described in issue #1455.
content.html:
ya that's the expected behavior now. If there is a material script then the rgba values are not used.

So clear the material script name and change the ambient again, it should work. Note that you can not revert back to the old material as described in issue #1455.

content.html: ticketed issue #1457
